content.prompt: Which of the following statements best describes the harmonic function of measure 18 in relation to the opening tonic of D minor?

choices.label: It completes an authentic cadence on the first inversion tonic of the original key, D minor.
It functions as the minor mediant harmony in the original key of D minor.
It shifts to F major, the relative major key.
It shifts to D major, the relative major key.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
